clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise and Neurocognition in Adults Relative to ApoE Genotype
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of an Integrated Intervention Program on Neurocognition in Late-Middle-Aged and Older Adults Relative to ApoE Genotypes: An ERP Study

brief_summary.textblock: The current project is a single-blinded, double-arm, 6-month randomized controlled trial aiming to assess the effects of a integrated intervention program on neurocognitive function with respect to event-related potential in adults aged 45-70 years. Additionally, the potential impacts of apolipoprotein epsilon-4 alleles and the brain-derived neurotrophic factor will be explored.

detailed_description.textblock:
While aging has been adversely associated with the alternations of cognitive function, several lifestyle factors (e.g., exercise, meditation, and social interaction) have been suggested reducing the age-related cognitive decline. Notably, most prior findings were based on research focused on single lifestyle factor. Accordingly, the effects of an intervention program combining multiple exercise modalities and lifestyle factors on neurocognitive function, as well as components of event-related potential (ERP), in middle-aged and older adults have not been thoroughly examined.
The current randomized clinical trial is designed to examine (1) whether a 6-month integrated intervention program (IIP) including multiple exercise modalities, meditation, and social interaction could benefit neurocognitive function (i.e., inhibition, shifting and attention) in middle-aged and older adults; (2) whether components of ERP will be influenced by the integrated intervention program; and (3) whether apolipoprotein E (ApoE) genotypes (ApoE e3/e4, ApoE e4/e4, ApoE e2/e2, ApoE e2/e3, ApoE e2/e4, and ApoE e3/e3), physical fitness, and brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) will influence the effects of integrated intervention program on neurocognitive function and components of ERPs.
The study will use a stratified permuted block randomization algorithm to assign 120 eligible participants into the IIP group or the active control (AC) group in a 1:1 ratio. Additionally, participants will be stratified by (1) age at study entry (â‰¤ 55 years vs. > 55 years), and Alzheimer's disease risk [High-risk status (ApoE e3/e4 and ApoE e4/e4) vs. Low-risk status (ApoE e2/e2, ApoE e2/e3, ApoE e2/e4, and ApoE e3/e3)], in order to ensure equal allocation to both groups, based on these criteria.
The IIP includes two 90-minutes sessions involving multiple exercise modalities (i.e., aerobic exercise, resistance exercise, coordinative exercise, and flexibility) and two lifestyle factors (i.e., meditation and social interaction). The AC group will be invited to attend two 90-minutes online educational course per week to eliminate the experimental expectation effect.
The neurocognitive function (e.g., inhibition, shifting, and attention performances), the components of ERP, ApoE genotype, physical fitness, and BDNF will be assessed at the baseline (Baseline-Assessment) and at the end of the 6-month intervention (Post-Assessment).

primary_outcome.measure: Inhibition: Changes in Stroop test performance
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes each at the baseline and at month 6
primary_outcome.description: The computerized Stroop test will be administrated to assess participants' inhibitory function, and the changes in Stroop test performance from baseline to end of the intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined.

primary_outcome.measure: Shifting: Changes in Task-Switching test performance
primary_outcome.time_frame: 25 minutes each at the baseline and at month 6
primary_outcome.description: The computerized Task-Switching test will be administrated to assess participants' shifting function, and changes in test performance from baseline to end of the intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined. The Task-Switching test includes 4 blocks, two of them are homogeneous and the other four are heterogeneous conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: Shifting: Changes in Trail-making test-B (TMT-B) performance
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes each at the baseline and at month 6
primary_outcome.description: The Trail-Making test-B (TMT-B) will be administrated to assess participants' shifting function, and changes in TMT-B test performance from baseline to end of the intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined. In the TMT-B, participants will be asked to draw a line to connect alternatively between numbers and Chinese zodiac animals (i.e., rat, cow, tiger, rabbit, dragon, etc.).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Digit symbol substitution test performance
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes each at baseline and at month 6
primary_outcome.description: The Digit symbol substitution test will be used to examine motor speed, sustained attention, visuomotor coordination, and response speed. The changes in test performance from baseline to end of the intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined. This task consists of nine digit-symbol pairs, and all participants will be required to substitute the corresponding symbols quickly and accurately.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 60 minutes each at baseline and at month 6
primary_outcome.description: The neuroelectrical activities during the computerized cognitive tasks will be recorded and analyzed using the Neuroscan system. Changes in the neuroelectrical activities from baseline to end of the intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined.

secondary_outcome.description: Based on the genetic biomarkers (rs429358 and rs7412), participants' ApoE genotype will be determined at the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood neurotrophic marker: Changes in brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes each at baseline and at month 6
secondary_outcome.description: 6 mL serum sample will be drawn from the antecubital veins to assess BDNF levels, and changes in BDNF levels from baseline to end of intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical fitness measurements: Changes in aerobic fitness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes each at baseline and at month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Participants' aerobic fitness will be assessed using the submaximal cycle ergometer test, and changes in aerobic fitness from baseline to end of intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical fitness measurements: Changes in muscular fitness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes each at baseline and at month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Muscular fitness will be assessed using either the push-up test/30 seconds or the chair stand test/30 seconds. The changes in muscular fitness from baseline to end of intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical fitness measurements: Changes in flexibility
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes each at baseline and at month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Flexibility will be assessed using the sit-and-reach test. The changes in flexibility from baseline to end of intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes each at baseline and at month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of mindfulness will be assessed using the 15-items (1-6 Likert scale) Chinese version of the Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MAAS) questionnaire. Higher mean scores of the 15 items indicates a higher levels of dispositional mindfulness. Changes in mindfulness scores from baseline to end of intervention (i.e., month 6) will be examined.

arm_group.description: Participants will attend the trainer-supervised program, which includes multiple physical fitness training, meditation, and social interaction, for 90 minutes/ session, 2 sessions/week for 6 months. Intervention: Behavioral: aerobic exercise, resistance exercise, coordinative exercise, flexibility, social interaction, and meditation.

The active control group will be invited to attend the online educational course at a frequency of 2 sessions per week for 90 minutes each to eliminate the experimental expectation effect. Intervention: Behavioral: online educational program.

intervention.description: The integrated interventional program will include (1) 15 minutes of warm-up and aerobic exercise from light to moderate intensity; (2) 25 minutes of resistance exercise and flexibility exercise; (3) 30 minutes of resistance exercise and coordinative exercise from the "Eastern exercise" perspective; (4) 10 minutes of social interaction exercise; (5) 10 minutes of cool-down and meditation. Participants will be encouraged to exercise at a moderate intensity for at least 20 minutes per session. Each exercise session will be supervised by certificated exercise instructors.

The active control group will be informed to maintain their lifestyles, and will be invited to attend the online educational course. The participants will be required to provide their physical activity behavior once every month for 6 months (6 times).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal or corrected-to-normal vision
- Able to speak and read Chinese
- Scores of Mini-Mental Status Examination >= 25
- Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire score < 0
- Able to conduct the exercise with moderate intensity
- Provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed or self-reported cognitive problems (e.g., mild cognitive impairment or dementia)
- Diagnosed or self-reported physical disease (e.g., untreated hypertension and chronic heart disease, stroke, brain tumor, musculoskeletal disorders, other exercise contradictions)
- Diagnosed or self-reported major psychiatric illness (e.g., major depression, schizophrenia)
- Diagnosed or self-reported neurodegenerative disease (e.g., Alzheimer's disease or other dementias, Parkinson's disease (PD) and PD-related disorders, Huntington's disease)
- History of alcohol or drug abuse
- History of chemotherapy
- Traveling consecutively for three weeks or more during the study
- Unwillingness to be randomized to one of the two groups
- Currently participating in another study trial
